poem:
"Of Mornings and Melted Ice Cream"

In the heart of every movie house,
Lies a moment frozen in time,
The metallic song of switched off freezers,
And joy found in a five pound crime.
Beneath that silent, silver screen,
Story of the night unfolds unseen,
While I, a humble student schemer,
Rekindled love with the shimmering cinema,
In the lap of melting Ben & Jerry's dreamer.
